Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The reasoning identifies that cases associated with the 'Highland Civic Darts Club' (C001, C004) receive a +10 point adjustment during scoring, while those not part of such a group do not.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning deduces that the +10 adjustment is automatically applied to applicants belonging to the community group, leading to lower score thresholds for those individuals.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Patterns among applications suggest that being in a community group likely depends on LocalResident being TRUE, as all applicants with community group affiliations are locals.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - NE
Text: The reasoning explores what would happen if C003 (a non-local) had been part of the Highland Civic Darts Club, concluding that they would have likely received +10 points and reached the threshold for approval.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The reasoning verifies that local applicants without a community group (e.g., C002) can still be approved if their preliminary score is sufficient, confirming that community group affiliation is not the sole factor but rather an additional advantage.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning proposes that the system is using community group affiliation as a proxy for LocalResident and indirectly favoring local applicants through score adjustments and potentially lower thresholds.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: The reasoning evaluates the fairness of the system, identifying that non-locals are disadvantaged by being excluded from community group benefits and potentially facing higher score thresholds.
